self.title: CDISC SDTM Observational Study Sampling Method Terminology

definition: The terminology relevant to the method by which the study population is selected in an observational study.
name: Observational Study Sampling Method
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Observational Study Sampling Method Terminology

terms.definition: A non-random process used to select a study population in which the participants have been selected based on convenience or with a particular purpose in mind.

An exclusively random process to guarantee that each participant or population has specified chance of selection, such as simple random sampling, systematic sampling, stratified random sampling, cluster sampling, and consecutive patient sampling. (clinicaltrials.gov)
